result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan L Statezny was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fin.Trans.Card-Fraud. Use (>$10,000), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a)1b.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The restitution is to be paid at no less that $200.00 per month on or before the 15th of each month commencing upon release from incarceration.

Restitution has been ordered satisfied and is at a zero balance per signed Order to Modify Sentence (attached).
The defendant may not enter onto the premises owned, occupied or used by the Crandon Area Rescue Squad.

The defendant must file state and federal income tax returns on or before 4/1 of each year and provide copies to P&P agent and surrender any refunds due her.

The defendant must comply with all rules of supervision.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed.

Community service authorized under 973.03(3).

The court has no objection to transfer to Oneida County but is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff - report to Forest County unless other wise instructed differently by Forest County Sheriff Department.

to modify sentence

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:19 AM. 14CF156 Also called 14CF18 for a motion hearing. Court states update on files. State makes statement regarding restitution on both matters. Ferguson - subject of motion is on 14CF18 - states motion regarding restitution already ordered on this matter. State responds and states his position on the motion - believes the insurance company should be paid restitution. Ferguson responds, states statute. State wants to amend the offer to include an additional $13,000.00 in restitution. Ferguson responds - reliance. Court states frustration. Court - 14CF18 - grants motion of defendant and finds that restitution has been paid in full and will not order reimbursement of the insurance company. 14CF156 - Ferguson would like a ruling on the verbal detrimental relieance motion. Court considers that the State has withdrawn the offer and sets the matter for a JT, will consider a motion for detrimental reliance  but not making a ruling on that at this point. State - 3 day JT. Court sets for JT. MIL due 5 days prior to JT and taken up morning of JT if normal MIL and otherwise 30 days prior to JT.

Motion was filed by Attorney Ferguson to Modify Sentence and a FPT was called on this date for 14CF156. Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case 14CF156 was called 4:20 PM. Discussion in regards to restitution amounts and agreement has not been made. Ferguson makes comment in regards to prior case 14CF18 and possible hearing a motion in that case. Motion to modify can be filed on 14CF18 and court appoints Ferguson specially on that case. Court will allow motion to be heard on 14CF18 and set this case for a plea date. Court advises parties to come to an agreement on these cases as an agreement was to be reached today.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Sentence
Motion hearing at 02-24-2016 10:45 am

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:34 PM. Court reviews file (14CF18) to see what motion is regarding - states concerns with restitution being paid to a victim as opposed to an insurance company. State responds. Drewa states he did not represent the defendant in the previous case (Patrick Finlan). Drewa has not spoken to the defendant regarding the first case. State responds - does not believe more restitution should be increased on 14CF18. Court will withhold the release of the request for 10 days (14CF18) and will allow Drewa time to respond to the request and will notify the court if a hearing is needed. If Court does not receive something from Drewa in 10 days, he will sign the amended restitution order but the amount of restitution originally ordered will not change - will not increase it as requested by insurance company. 14CF156 - here for FPT/MH for expert witness fees. Drewa - not resolved and explains. Court will sign the paperwork submitted by Drewa regarding appointing an expert. Drewa states request for expert investigator being appointed. Court will authorize no more than 5 hours for an investigator at no more than $45.00/hr. Drewa to prepare order for Court's signature. Court continues bond and sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: undecided
State's settlement recommendation

Called at 10:09 AM. Megan Statezny appears in person and wtih counsel Patrick Finlan. State appears by JBC. Finlan - resolved - goes thru plea questionnaire form regarding conditions. State - pleading g/nc to count #2 as alleged, DRI #1, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 5 years with conditions of: 120 days in FC jail, costs, pay $26,785.66 restitution inclusive of VW surcharge - paid at no less than $200.00/month on or before the 15th of each month - file state and federal income tax returns on or before 4/15 of each year and provide copies to P&P agent and surrender any refunds due her, AODA at discretion of agent and follow thru, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 200 hours of community service, no contact with victims - any member of the Crandon Area Rescue Squad except for employment related contact. Discussion on the no contact provision. State has complied with the victim notification requirements. Finlan agrees with the agreement as stated but makes record regarding the condition of the no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns and to leave that condition up to the discretion of the P&P agent along with the AODA condition. State agrees and has no objection to that modification of the joint recommendation. Statezny pleads NC to count #2 as alleged. Court DRI #1. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State -  nothing further. Finlan makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - makes argument for serving the sentence in Oneida County - asks for time to report. Statezny makes/reads statement, remorseful. Court inquires of some of the victims that are in the Courtroom regarding the no contact provision. Discussion on any possible insurance claims for the restitution. State provides court with paperwork regarding that - Finlan and Court review. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 5 years with conditions of: 120 days in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - no objection to transfer to Oneida County but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff - report to Forest County unless otherwise instructed differently by FOSO - report on 7/30/14 at 7:30 AM - credit for 3 days only if revoked (stipulated), no entry onto the premises owned, occupied or used by the Crandon Area Rescue Squad, 400 hours of community service, restitution on $26,785.66 including VW surcharge - paid at no less than $200.00/month on or before the 15th of each month commencing upon release for incarceration - file state and federal income tax returns on or before 4/1 of each year and provide copies to P&P agent and surrender any refunds due her, comply with all rules of supervision, costs - paid thru probation, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed - paid thru probation, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Megan L Statezny in court with attorney Patrick H Finlan.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:17 pm. Resolved. Finlan indicates plea today and sentencing at a later date for stated reasons. Finlan still has some questions regarding the restitution and would like to talk to state about it. Court is not going to adjourn sentencing for stated reasons. Finlan respectfully requests that the sentencing adjourned about a month out for stated reasons. Court makes statement regarding plea and sentencing issues been policy to do all at once. Court will adjourn out however makes parties aware that if jail is ordered she will be required to report that day and must have witnesses that day.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on July 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 1:37 PM. Megan Statezny appears in person and with counsel Patrick Finlan. State appears by Charles Simono. State - just received discovery that was mailed on 5/22/14 and has not had a chance to review it with the client. Finlan agrees. Court continues bond, set for another FPT on 7/2/14 at 1:15 PM.

Called at 3:37 PM. Megan Statezny appears in person and with counsel Patrick Finlan. State appears by Charles Simono. Court has waiver of PH and State has filed Information that mirrors the complaint in anticipation of that. Court goes thru waiver of PH, find the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Finlan has Information that mirrors the complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court continues bond, accepts pleas, set for FPT on 04/30/14 at 1:15 PM.
